title: OnOptions
description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

items.title: The only phone notifications Jamie Dimon gets are from his kids—everyone else has to call the office
items.description: "If you send me a text during the day, I probably do not read it," Dimon said.

items.title: Your Staff Are Hiding Their Menopause Symptoms. Here’s How You Can Help
items.description: An open, supportive company culture may help many women feel safer about discussing their experiences.

items.title: From Jamie Dimon to Bill Ackman, Wall Street’s billionaires are now changing their tune and offering to help Zohran Mamdani
items.description: Over $22 million was spent by billionaires to prevent the democratic socialist from becoming mayor-elect, estimates say.

items.title: Delta CEO Ed Bastian rejected a mentor’s advice for how to run the $38 billion airline: ‘He told me I’ll never have a moment of peace’
items.description: Delta CEO Ed Bastian says he reads through thousands of customer emails while flying in coach.

items.title: Gen-Z Talks About Their Salaries Openly. Should Your Company Embrace Pay Transparency?
items.description: Some countries have laws mandating salaries be public knowledge. The U.S. plays by different workplace rules, but things might be changing.

items.title: Another AI Winter Is Coming—But This One Will Be Different
items.description: Right now we are in an AI summer. It’s possible we’re heading toward an AI winter. But that doesn’t mean the end of AI.
